alert.note: Alert for Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 5:53PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Martin and northwestern Pike Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 553 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Heenan, or 12 miles south of Inez, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Laura and Varney around 600 PM EDT. Conder, Heisey, Coalpoint and Pilgrim around 605 PM EDT. Rural, Hatfield Station, Whitepost, Oppy and Sidney around 610 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Forest Hills, Turkey Creek and Belfry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
